danger_zone

Class DangerNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • danger_zone.DangerNode

  • public class DangerNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    2012-10-2 The DangerNode class is a node of a K-d Tree of dimensionality 2. It contains an id for reference to an outside database as well as a timestamp identified with the time the Danger Zone took place or was entered into the database. The Node is sorted by longitude and latitude which are stored in the coordinates array in their respective order.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public DangerNode search(float[] searchTuple)
        Searches the tree for the searchTuple given, returns null if not found and a DangerNode if found. Note this search is note the nearest neighbor search
        Parameters:
        searchTuple - The tuple of floats we're searching for.
        Returns:
        null if not found, the DangerNode if found.

      • innerSearch

        private DangerNode innerSearch(float[] searchTuple,
                     int depth)
        Search used by search function to search along the correct axis given the depth of the tree
        Parameters:
        searchTuple - the tuple of floats we're searching for.
        depth - The depth of the tree, required to compute the proper sorting axis of the tree
        Returns:
        null if not found, the DangerNode if found.

      • nearestNeighbor

        public java.util.Stack<DangerNode> nearestNeighbor(float[] searchTuple,
                                          int numOfNeighbors)
        Nearest neighbor search on this DangerNode. Returns up to numOfNeighbors neighbors.
        Parameters:
        searchTuple - The tuple we'd like to find neighbors for.
        numOfNeighbors - How many neighbors one would like maximum from the tree, the function will not neccesary return this number of nodes
        Returns:
        Returns a Stack of DangerNodes of nearest neighbors to the searchTuple

      • innerNN

        public java.util.Stack<DangerNode> innerNN(float[] searchTuple,
                                  int depth,
                                  java.util.Stack<DangerNode> bests)
        Helper function to perform the nearest neighbor algorithm
        Parameters:
        searchTuple - The tuple to find neighbors for
        depth - Depth of the current node
        bests - Stack to store current best neighbors in
        Returns:
        Returns stack of DangerNodes of nearest neighbors to the searchTuple
